newsitem.title: UK: MEPC appoints Dundas finance director.
newsitem.headline: MEPC appoints Dundas finance director.

text.p: UK property investment company MEPC said on Monday that it was appointing James Dundas as finance director with immediate effect.

Dundas, 46, was previously finance director of the Airport Authority in Hong Kong with responsibility for finances including accounting, treasury, capital raising, financial planning, budgetary and financial risk management functions.
"(Dundas') wealth of experience in international financing and in financial and commercial management will be a great benefit to the company," said MEPC's chief executive James Tuckey in a statement.

The appointment of Dundas follows a management reorganisation outlined last September and an announcement last month of a number of key initiatives to boost efficiency, focus and increasing shareholder value.
These included outsourcing MEPC's non-core facilities management and moving its headquarters.
